bibl.title: Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: make a complaint. He said he would him arrested & would make the complaint. That he had a requisition for him from the Governor ofTexas I arrested this man & took him to my office M. Jackson came in topop to him and said I think . "How, do you do Wallack" Leiffman looked at Jackson, but made no reply. I asked M. Jackson if that was the man he wanted. He said that it was & he had a requisition for him & to look out for him that he was a shippey dog. I told him Jackson to go go & see the prosecuting attorney. Said that he had papers for him & that he hd given them to sheriff Thompson of Walla Walla that then was $500 reward offered for him & that John Justice was appointed agent to convey him to Texas. Jackson told me that Leiffman had later $20,000ny 30000 and he had employed experts & he thought he had taken more than that. He made no complaints. Have ahd Leiffman in custodyy since
